item.title: Hyper Light Breaker - Save Over 20% On Steam Keys With This Launch Deal
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/hyper-light-breaker-save-over-20-on-steam-keys-with-this-launch-deal/1100-6528813/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The new roguelike action-RPG Hyper Light Breaker is on sale for $23.39 until January 21 at Fanatical. The latest release from heralded indie developer Heart Machine entered early access on Steam today, January 14, so this is a pretty generous launch discount.

While purchasing Hyper Light Breaker through Fanatical gets you an official Steam key, Steam is also offering a special launch deal that bundles Hyper Light Breaker with a free copy of the first entry in the series, the Zelda-inspired action-adventure game Hyper Light Drifter, for $27 (was $30). Fanatical's Hyper Light Breaker launch deal does not include the bonus Hyper Light Drifter key, but it's worth considering if you want to save some cash on the new game--especially if you already own Hyper Light Drifter.

According to the early access launch trailer, Hyper Light Breaker is a prequel set before the events of Drifter. Players take on the role of Breakers, who are elite warriors tasked with restoring civilization by exploring an ever-changing realm called The Overgrowth and defeating the evil Abyss King who controls it. Players team up in online co-op and head out in expeditions to explore, defeat bosses, and collect loot--then return to base to upgrade the settlement with the resources you acquired, gear up, and head back out to an all-new version of the Overgrowth.

Note that like all early access games, Hyper Light Breaker is not considered a finished game yet, and you're likely to encounter some bugs and performance issues if you dive in now. Steam users have already reported a range of issues with the controls, customization options, the combat, and more. Heart Machine is working to address performance issues and bugs as quickly as possible. AS of 5:30 PM PT, Hyper Light Breaker holds a "Mixed" review average on Steam based on roughly 600 reviews.

The initial early access version only includes a portion of the planned final content, with more playable characters, bosses, equipment types, and other additional updates planned between now and the final launch. Hyper Light Drifter's Steam page says the early access period is planned to last around a year, but that is subject to change.

Between making Hyper Light Drifter and Breaker, Heart Machine also launched the 3D platformer Solar Ash. While the gameplay style differs from the Hyper Light series, Solar Ash shares many of the same aesthetic elements and is worth checking out to see what else the team has made. Luckily, it is also on sale at Fanatical, where you can pick it up for just $30.65 (was $40).

Games purchased at Fanatical are delivered instantly as official keys that can be redeemed on major storefronts (mostly Steam). All Fanatical purchases also include a 5%-off coupon code that can be used on a future order.

If you're looking for something to use that coupon on, the retailer has several other deals running right now, including build-your-own-bundle deals like the January 2025 Diamond Collection that includes games like Control, Nickelodeon All Stars Brawl 2, and Saints Row Gold Edition for as low as $4.50 per game. There's also the latest version of Fanatical's Slayer Bundle that's packed with indies for as low as $1.43 per game, and a customizable Monster Hunter Bundle that includes Monster Hunter World, Monster Hunter Rise, Monster Hunter Stories 2, and numerous DLC packs for as low as $3.12 per item.

Disclosure: GameSpot and Fanatical are both owned by Fandom.

item.title: Cult-Favorite Capcom Fighter Rival Schools Getting An Official Works Artbook Soon
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/cult-favorite-capcom-fighter-rival-schools-getting-an-official-works-artbook-soon/1100-6527128/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

While it's been decades since the Rival Schools game, fans have some cool releases to look forward to this year. Not only is the Rival School sequel, Project Justice, appearing in the upcoming Capcom Fighting Collection 2, but the cult-classic Capcom fighting game series is also getting a new Rival Schools: Complete Works art book. The hardcover tome will offer a comprehensive look at the tag-team fighter's visuals and development history when it launches on April 29, 2025. Preorders are now available and discounted to just $40 (was $50) at Amazon.

Rival Schools: Complete Works

$40 (was $50) | Releases April 29

Like the other Capcom Complete Works books published by Udon Entertainment, the Rival Schools edition collects the artwork of all three Rival Schools games, including key art, character illustrations, development sketches, unused character concepts, and more.

The first Rival Schools game, Rival Schools: United By Fate, was released in 1997 and focused on tag team battles between teams of students from various schools. The series has seen two follow-up games since then--a Japan-exclusive update of the first game called Justice Private Academy: Fighting Spirit Diary 2 in 1999, followed by the sequel Project Justice in 2000. The series has been largely dormant since then, outside of a few Rival School character cameo appearances in other Capcom fighting games, which makes the new Complete Works artbook and Project Justice's inclusion in Capcom Fighting Collection 2 later this year all the more exciting.

Speaking of which, preorders for the PS4 and Nintendo Switch physical editions of Capcom Fighting Collection 2 are available now at Amazon and include a limited-edition Capcom vs. SNK comic. The collection features eight games, including Project Justice, Capcom vs. SNK 1 and 2, Power Stone 1 and 2, and more.

If you're looking for more Capcom reading material, several other Complete Works art books based on the company's other franchises like Street Fighter, Devil May Cry, or Mega Man are also available. These collections feature official artwork and behind-the-scenes insights into how these games were created, including glimpses at early concepts and even cut content. Check out the links below for a list of all the Capcom Complete Works artbooks that are available now or up for preorder.

More Capcom Art Books

  • Mega Man X DiVE: Official Complete Works -- $50 | Releases March 25
  • Street Fighter V: Climax Arts + Alpha to 6 -- $60 | Releases April 15
  • The Art of Street Fighter -- $60
  • Devil May Cry 5: Official Artworks -- $39.71 ($55)
  • Asura's Wrath: Official Complete Works -- $36.18 ($40)
  • Sengoku Basara Samurai Heroes: Official Complete Works -- $40
  • Mega Man Star Force: Official Complete Works Hardcover -- $45
  • Street Fighter IV & Super Street Fighter IV: Official Complete Works -- $38.83

item.title: Learn More About Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty's Development With This Upcoming Art Book
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/learn-more-about-wo-long-fallen-dynastys-development-with-this-upcoming-art-book/1100-6528749/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The world of Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty is one where gruesome monsters are juxtaposed against beautiful landscapes, and everything is tied together with deep lore based on Chinese history and folklore. If youâ€™re interested in learning more about the game and its development, The Art of Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty is now available to preorder ahead of its July 7 release.

The Art of Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty

$50 | Releases July 7

This hardcover art book spans 192 pages, each filled with character designs, creature designs, and various concept art for Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty. Along with hundreds of images, youâ€™ll also get a detailed rundown of character profiles, world lore, and more. Considering the game has deep mythology to pull from, there should be plenty of incredible details packed between its covers. Wo Long was quite popular when it released in 2023--if youâ€™re worried about the art book selling out, consider landing a preorder soon. Note that the final cover art has not yet been revealed.

The book is being published by Udon Entertainment--a brand that has previously worked on art books for Elden Ring, Dark Souls, Bloodborne, and Monster Hunter. All of these earned positive reviews from readers, and The Art of Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty should retain the brandâ€™s high-quality publishing standards.

These previous volumes also make great companions for the upcoming book, and since many are currently on sale, theyâ€™re worth checking out ahead of The Art of Wo Longâ€™s release in July. Hereâ€™s a look at some of our favorite art book deals, including those from Udon Entertainment and beyond.

More Art Book Deals

  • Dark Souls: Design Works (Hardcover) -- $30 ($40)
  • Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume 1 (Hardcover) -- $60 (Preowned)
  • Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume 2 (Hardcover) -- $36 ($60)
  • Bloodborne Official Artworks (Paperback) -- $38 ($45)
  • Monster Hunter Illustrations (Hardcover) -- $45
  • Monster Hunter Illustrations 2 (Hardcover) -- $40 ($55)
  • Nioh & Nioh 2: Official Artworks (Hardcover) -- $37 ($55)
  • The Art of Lies of P (Hardcover) -- $40 ($50)
  • Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice Official Artworks (Paperback) -- $36 ($50)

Havenâ€™t yet played Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty? The PC version is currently discounted at Fanatical, letting you pick up the hit game for just $50 (was $60). Our Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty review gave the game an impressive 8/10, praising it for thrilling combat, an impressive sense of mobility, and a unique setting heavily influenced by Chinese mythology.

Disclosure: GameSpot and Fanatical are both owned by Fandom.

item.title: Hyper Light Breaker Devs Promise Bug Fixes Are Coming
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/hyper-light-breaker-devs-promise-bug-fixes-are-coming/1100-6528819/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

It's been the better part of a decade since Hyper Light Drifter was released, but the prequel, Hyper Light Breaker, finally made it into early access this week after a nearly two-year delay. Players on Steam have left some unflattering reviews about the game's bugs at this stage, but developer Heart Machine is promising that fixes are on the way.

In a post on social media, Heart Machine apologized for the issues with the game and noted that it is "pushing out performance improvements ASAP." In a separate post, Heart Machine invited players to share their dxdiag info on Discord if they're having problems on a machine that meets or exceeds the game's system requirements.

ðŸ›‘Apologies for anyone experiencing issues!ðŸ›‘ We're pushing out performance improvements ASAP.
We're adding a vsync toggle, but for now, you can add this launch option in Steam to enable vsync "-ExecCmds="r.vsync 1""
We'll also roll out mouse sensitivity settings ASAP! pic.twitter.com/V2sTGHDPle

â€” Hyper Light Breaker - Early Access NOW LIVE! (@HLBreaker) January 14, 2025

The early reviews on Steam are mostly negative, with common complaints about the lack of sensitivity settings, stiff movement and combat, the inability to rebind command keys, and a largely non-existant story compared to the first game. A few of the reviews have good things to say about the combat in this roguelike game, but the general consensus is that Hyper Light Breaker lacks polish even at this stage in its development. Heart Machine has replied to some of the negative reviews and said it will address the issues that were brought up.

Hyper Light Breaker is currently available at a discounted price of $27 on Steam, which will rise to $30 once that promotion ends. Additionally, Fanatical is offering an even better deal for a Steam key for $23.39. For now, it's too soon to say if Heart Machine's fixes will turn around the early response to this game.

Fanatical and GameSpot are both owned by Fandom.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Lunar Remastered Collection Physical Edition Is Exclusive To Amazon
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/lunar-remastered-collection-physical-edition-is-exclusive-to-amazon/1100-6528818/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Lunar Remastered Collection launches on PS4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and PC on April 18, and the console versions are getting Amazon-exclusive physical editions. At the time of writing, Amazon hasn't unlocked preorders yet, but store pages are live for physical editions for PS4, Nintendo Switch, and Xbox One. We'd recommend double-checking by clicking the links below, as preorders should unlock very soon. We'll update this preorder guide once Amazon starts taking preorders.

Lunar Remastered Collection Amazon Listings:

  • PlayStation (PS4 & PS5)
  • Nintendo Switch
  • Xbox (Series X & Xbox One)

Lunar Remastered Collection Physical Edition (PS4, Switch)

$55 | Releases April 18

The Lunar Remastered Collection includes enhanced versions of Lunar: Silver Star Story Complete and its sequel, Lunar 2: Eternal Blue Complete.

Both games feature retouched graphics, enhanced audio, new English localizations, and gameplay tweaks like optional battle speed increases to make the classic RPGs more approachable.

The Amazon-exclusive physical editions have reversible cover art featuring both Lunar and Lunar 2 by series illustrator and anime artist Toshiyuki Kubooka.

A digital version of the collection will also be available for consoles and PC via Steam.

This collection sounds like an excellent way to experience two of the most important RPGs from the 16-bit and 32-bit console eras. The original Lunar: Silver Star Story is considered a landmark title in the Japanese RPG lineage and was one of the first console RPGs to feature voice acting, animated cutscenes, and CD-quality music thanks to its original platform, the Sega CD. It was later remade for PS1 and Sega Saturn as Lunar: Silver Star Story Complete, which is the version included in the Lunar Remastered Collection. Its sequel, Lunar 2: Eternal Blue, also launched on PS1 and Saturn and built upon the gameplay and story presentation of the first game, featuring even more voiced dialogue and a larger cast.

Voice acting, cutscenes, and high-quality soundtracks are now common elements of video games, they were groundbreaking at the time--though the voice performances and the localized English script are now notorious for their uneven quality. However, the new Remastered Collection includes all-new English text and voice acting for both games. While the new English voice tracks replace the originals, the Lunar Remastered collection includes the option to play with Japanese voice acting instead. You can also swap between the new enhanced visuals or the PS1 visuals for both games.

Lunar isn't the only classic RPG series getting long-awaited remasters this year. Konami RPGs Suikoden 1 and 2 are also returning with the Suikoden 1 & 2 HD Remaster that launches , and cult-classic Tales of Graces f is returning with a remaster on consoles and PC on January 17 and preorder now.

item.title: The Sims 3 Gets Its First Update In Almost A Decade
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-sims-3-gets-its-first-update-in-almost-a-decade/1100-6528817/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Sims 25th anniversary is next month, and as expected, EA has loads of activities, updates and new content planned for the celebration. But one thing players weren't expecting was the surprise update EA just launched for The Sims 3.

The new update simply fixes an issue that made newer Intel CPUs unable to run The Sims 3, allowing the game to be run on modern machines more easily. Although EA hasn't made a public statement regarding the update, some players are hoping this could mean more updates for The Sims 3 are on the way.

Whether that's the case or not is hard to say. After all, EA hasn't even publicly acknowledged that it launched the update. But even if EA has no more planned content for The Sims 3, players--and modders especially--are thrilled to see new life breathed into the game.

"So it begins," Sims modder SimMattically tweeted after discovering the update.

The last time The Sims 3 received an update was back in November 2015, and it's entirely possible the latest update was simply released to ensure players continue to buy the game. But players who miss the game's incredibly detailed customization options (many of which are still absent from The Sims 4) are happy to see this update, even if it's not necessarily indicative that more Sims 3 content is on the way.

During its heyday, The Sims 3 struggled to run even on high-end PCs. Crashes and bugs were common, but players loved the ability to make Sims' hair, clothes, nails, and furniture any color they wished via the game's color wheel. That color wheel is almost entirely absent from The Sims 4--it can be used when coloring a pet's fur, but cannot be used on Sims' hair, clothes, furniture, walls, or flooring. Sims 4 players have bemoaned the game's lack of customization options for years, and since modern machines will now have an easier time running The Sims 3 without crashing, the latest update allows nostalgic Simmers to travel back to the good old days, when Sims (and their houses) could be any color of the rainbow.

There's no telling whether EA will release further updates for The Sims 3--and if they do, those updates are likely to be focused on stability improvements rather than new content. Still, being able to load up an ancient save file and customize Sims to your heart's content is certainly something to celebrate, even if the update itself isn't officially a part of The Sims 25th Anniversary celebration.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: The Sims 25th Anniversary Celebration Features Free Content, In-Game Events, And A 25-Hour Stream
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-sims-25th-anniversary-celebration-features-free-content-in-game-events-and-a-25-hour-stream/1100-6528814/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Sims is celebrating its 25th anniversary next month, but EA kicked off the festivities early via a new episode of Behind The Sims, giving players a peek at what the future holds for The Sims 4, including base game updates, free in-game content, and a trio of new Kits.

The latest episode, which aired live on The Sims' YouTube channel, provided a look at the game's upcoming content roadmap and hinted at some other surprises, including a 25-hour livestream that will feature a "special guest [who players] might know."

Per EA, The Sims 25th Anniversary celebration schedule is as follows:

  • January 14: The Sims 4 main menu UI overhaul
  • January 16: Three new Kits launch, including the Secret Sanctuary Kit, the Casanova Cave Kit, and the Comfy Gamer Kit, the latter of which was created in collaboration with popular Sims 4 YouTuber LilSimsie.
  • January 27 - 31: Nostalgia Now Event (No details have been shared regarding this event, though it could be a login event that rewards players with exclusive in-game items.)
  • February 4:
    • A 25-hour livestream featuring the aforementioned mysterious special guest will take place.
    • The Sims 4 Blast From The Past Event begins, featuring free rewards "inspired by iconic items from the 2000s, like a milk carton, telephone, alarm clock, triple-tiered birthday cake, and inflatable chair and loveseat."
    • The Sims 4 will receive new (free) base game content featuring over 70 new in-game items including hairstyle, basic clothing, new swatches, and more.
  • February 6: Motherload Season begins. EA hasn't yet shared details regarding what exactly this event will consist of, but given the fact that it's named after the in-game cheat used to fill a Sim's bank account with cash, it's probably safe to say this season will be all about those sweet, sweet Simoleons.
  • February 25: ???

Whatever EA has planned for February 25, The Sims 4 devs are keeping their lips zipped for now, with an emoji of two large eyeballs in place of the event's description. But it's possible that February 25 will see the announcement of the game's next expansion packs, as EA has historically used large Sims-based events to promote upcoming DLC.

The livestream also revealed that The Sims 25th Anniversary event will include a free update that gives the game's generally underwhelming townie homes a much-needed makeover, with pools and other features that weren't available when those houses were first created. It's unclear if the digital dollhouse redecoration will take place as part of the free update on February 4, or if it will launch later in the month.

For more information on all the new content coming to The Sims 4, The Sims FreePlay, and MySims: Cozy Bundle--plus details on The Sims 25th Anniversary merch--check out EA's recent blog post.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: PGA Tour 2K25 Releases Very Soon, Preorders Unlock Shooter McGavin From Happy Gilmore
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pga-tour-2k25-releases-very-soon-preorders-unlock-shooter-mcgavin-from-happy-gilmore/1100-6528803/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

PGA Tour 2K25 has been officially revealed by 2K Sports, with a tee time thatâ€™s just around the corner. The latest entry in the awesome golf sim series releases February 28 on PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC. It's the first new entry since 2022's PGA Tour 2K23, and it is bringing a bunch of exciting new features, including three of golf's Major Championships: the PGA Championship, US Open, and The Open. PGA Tour 2K25 preorders are available now at Amazon for PS5 and Xbox Series X. Preorders unlock Shooter McGavin from Happy Gilmore as a playable character.

PGA Tour 2K25 Preorder Bonuses

If you preorder any edition of PGA 2K25, you'll unlock Chris McDonald (Shooter McGavin) as a playable character. McDonald is reprising his iconic role opposite Adam Sandler in Happy Gilmore 2, which is slated to release on Netflix this year. You'll also get a cosmetics pack, so your created golfer can dress like Shooter.

Happy Gilmore: Extra Butter x Adidas Pack

  • Playable character Chris McDonald (Shooter McGavin from Happy Gilmore)
  • Shooter Collection Hat
  • Shooter Collection Jacket
  • Shooter Collection Shoes

The Deluxe and Legend Editions come with early access starting February 20 and a bunch of additional in-game bonuses outlined below.

Ready to hit the links? Hereâ€™s a look at the three editions of PGA Tour 2K25 up for preorder, along with a look at available preorder bonuses. Below the preorder details, we've outlined some of the new features present in PGA 2K25.

PGA Tour 2K25 Standard Edition

$70

PGA 2K25's physical edition cover features three pros: Tiger Woods, Matt Fitzpatrick, and Max Homa. The cover also has an Easter Egg of sorts. Tiger's iconic celebration from the 2008 US Open, which he won while playing with a broken leg, is recreated on the cover.

The standard edition is the only physical version of PGA Tour 2K25. Preorders are available now for $70 for PS5 and Xbox Series X at Amazon and GameStop.

Digital copies can be found on the Xbox Store, PlayStation Store, and Steam. If you preorder a digital copy, you'll also get a copy of PGA 2K23 that unlocks on February 21.

Additionally, creating and linking a 2K account and signing up for the newsletter will get you 250 VC and an in-game 2K Bucket Hat.

PGA Tour 2K25 Deluxe Edition

$100

The Deluxe Edition is available in digital format only, but it comes with some nice extras. This includes:

  • Base game
  • Extra Butter x Adidas Pack
  • Birdie Pack: Titleist GT4 Driver, Titleist Golf Ball Cosmetic, Footjoy Premiere Series Shoes, Umbrella Hat, and 3 Golf Ball Fittings
  • Starter Pack: 1,800 VC, 1 Evo Tool, 3 Ball Fittings, 5 Club Fittings, and 5 Level-Up Tokens

PGA Tour 2K25 Legend Edition

$120

The $120 Legend Edition includes everything from Deluxe, plus the following:

  • Memberâ€™s Pass: Unlocks Clubhouse Pass Premium for the first five Seasons and Clubhouse Gear Pack with 1 outfit per body type per Season
  • Malbon Bucket Ball Pack: 3 Malbon cosmetics balls
  • Sun Day Red Pack: Red 3 Button Polo, Black Ballcap, Black Pants, White Gloves, TaylorMade Driver Qi10

Like the Deluxe Edition, the Legend Edition is only available in digital format.

Along with Woods, Homa, and Fitzpatrick, 2K has revealed a handful of other playable PGA and LPGA pros, including Justin Thomas, Tony Finau, Lydia Ko, Tom Kim, and Brooke Henderson.

2K is also introducing the new EvoSwing mechanics, allowing you to make better use of shot types, ball flights, and roll physics, which should give you more flexibility when deciding how to approach each course. Youâ€™ll also find an improved MyCareer mode thatâ€™s more customizable than ever alongside new creation tools.

Youâ€™ll have plenty of content to play through when the game hits store shelves on February 28, with 29 courses available at launch. This includes beloved tracks like The Players Stadium Course at TPC Sawgrass plus new arrivals like the 2025 US Open at Oakmont Country Club and the 2025 PGA Championship at Quail Hollow Club. Toss in a course designer, Topgolf mode, and seasonal content to keep things fresh, and it sounds like an exciting follow-up to PGA 2K23, which we awarded a 8/10 in our review.
